definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers

sentences.english: Plus, although she's a vampire, she doesn't go around killing innocent humans.
sentences.chinese: 最后，尽管她是一名吸血鬼，她并没有滥杀无辜人类。

sentences.english: The last one of the pure-blooded vampires of the third generation in far east.
sentences.chinese: 远东最后一个血统纯正的第三代吸血鬼。

sentences.english: A group of uninteresting people fishing fishing profits vampire son of the SA.
sentences.chinese: 一群无趣的捞名捞利的吸血的瘙子。

sentences.english: Dracula himself is a depiction of such attitudes toward immigrants by British natives.
sentences.chinese: 吸血鬼便成为英国本土人对移民态度的一种描述。

sentences.english: In china, these bloodsuckers would be executed.
sentences.chinese: 在中国这些吸血鬼会被判死刑。

sentences.english: I was a new born vampire, weeping at the beauty of the night.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个新生的吸血鬼，夜色之美令我哭。

sentences.english: How can all those eye-witnesses to these creatures of the night be wrong?
sentences.chinese: 在晚上看到这些吸血鬼人的目击者怎么可能是错的呢？

sentences.english: The full moon seems to follow them wherever they go.
sentences.chinese: 似乎吸血鬼走到哪里，满月就跟到哪里。
你是一只活力吸血鬼吗？

sentences.english: The other vampire bats came around and asked him how he got so much blood.
sentences.chinese: 其他吸血蝙蝠围过来，问他怎么得到这么多血。

sentences.english: But they share a charming tenderness. They became the template for all culturally-relevant vampires that followed them.
sentences.chinese: 他们俨然成了之后文化题材中吸血鬼的模板。

sentences.english: Hope to show them to help deal with the vampire.
sentences.chinese: 希望显祖给以协助对付吸血鬼。

sentences.english: Vv:Victor the vampire is a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 吸血鬼维克多是一个素食者。

sentences.english: A short space of time, I fell in love with robots from vampiric .
sentences.chinese: 才一会会时间，我就从吸血鬼爱上了机器人。

sentences.english: He needed it like a vampire needs blood.
sentences.chinese: 他需要爱就像吸血鬼需要血一样。

definition: leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
(literary) beauty (usually of a maid or concubine)
night demon (malign spirit believed to plague people during sleep)
